The West of Middle-earth at the End of the Third Age

wikitext.*:
'''Ras Morthil''' must be another name for [[Andrast]], the great headland at the end of the northern arm of the [[Bay of Belfalas]].<ref>{{UT|4a}}, note 6</ref><ref>{{UT|Map}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name ''Ras Morthil'' likely consists of the [[Sindarin]] word ''[[ras]]'' ("cape, shore") and the word ''Morthil''. ''Morthil'' likely contains the elements ''[[mor]]'' ("dark, black") and the nasally mutated ''[[til]]'' ("point, spike, (sharp) horn, tine, ending").<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-9082681.html|articlename=Ras Morthil|dated=|website=[http://eldamo.org/ eldamo.org]|accessed=31 May 2021}}</ref><ref group=note>In [[Aldarion and Erendis]] it is mentioned that [[Aldarion]] "rounded the dark cape of Ras Morthil".</ref>
